section.title: Release 1.12.9
section.para: Release 1.12.9 is the latest in the stable 1.12 series of OpenNMS. It contains a number of important fixes including handling jetty.xml upgrades better, and a fix for a bug in the rescanExisting flag when provisioning. See What's New in OpenNMS 1.12 for a general list of changes in the 1.12 series.
The codename for 1.12.9 is Bruce Springsteen

section.title: Release 1.12.8
section.para: Release 1.12.8 is the 9th in the stable 1.12 series of OpenNMS. It contains an important fix for a security issue that can expose files outside of the OpenNMS directory through the web interface. See What's New in OpenNMS 1.12 for a general list of changes in the 1.12 series.
The codename for 1.12.8 is John Petrucci

section.title: Release 1.12.7
section.para: Release 1.12.7 is the eighth in the stable 1.12 series of OpenNMS. It contains a number of important fixes including a XSS vulnerability, and also introduces a potentially incompatible change to the way the web UI is configured. For details on the web UI changes, see "Changes to the Web UI Startup" on the "What's New in OpenNMS 1.12" page.
The codename for 1.12.7 is Bob Marley

section.title: Release 1.12.6
section.para: Release 1.12.6 is the seventh in the stable 1.12 series of OpenNMS. It contains a number of important fixes including a potential security leak in the ReST interface. see What's New in OpenNMS 1.12.
The codename for 1.12.6 is Sascha Konietzko

section.title: Release 1.12.5
section.para: Release 1.12.5 is the sixth in the stable 1.12 series of OpenNMS. It contains a fix for upgrades when using storeByForeignSource, plus a few other small changes. see What's New in OpenNMS 1.12.
The codename for 1.12.5 is John Lee Hooker

section.title: Release 1.12.4
section.para: Release 1.12.4 is the fifth in the stable 1.12 series of OpenNMS. It contains more upgrade tool bugfixes, as well as a number of small bug fixes and enhancements. see What's New in OpenNMS 1.12.
The codename for 1.12.4 is Iggy Pop

section.title: Release 1.12.3
section.para: Release 1.12.3 is the fourth in the stable 1.12 series of OpenNMS. It contains a critical bugfix to the upgrade tools added in 1.12.2, as well as a few small config updates. see What's New in OpenNMS 1.12.
The codename for 1.12.3 is Charles Mingus

section.title: Release 1.12.2
section.para: Release 1.12.2 is the third in the stable 1.12 series of OpenNMS. It contains quite a few bug fixes and enhancements since the 1.12.1 release. For a high-level overview of what has changed since OpenNMS 1.10, see What's New in OpenNMS 1.12.
The codename for 1.12.2 is Liberace

section.title: Release 1.12.1
section.para: Release 1.12.1 is the second in the stable 1.12 series of OpenNMS. It contains a number of bug fixes and small enhancements since the 1.12.0 release. For a high-level overview of what has changed since OpenNMS 1.10, see What's New in OpenNMS 1.12.
The codename for 1.12.1 is Patrick Murphy

section.title: Release 1.12.0
section.para: Release 1.12.0 is the first in the stable 1.12 series of OpenNMS. It contains a number of bug fixes since the 1.11.94 release. For a high-level overview of what has changed since OpenNMS 1.10, see What's New in OpenNMS 1.12.
The codename for 1.12.0 is Barry Privett

section.title: Release 1.11.94
section.para: Release 1.11.94 is the third release candidate for the OpenNMS 1.12 series. It contains more bugfixes and cleanups.
The codename for 1.11.94 is Dave Grohl

section.title: Release 1.11.93
section.para: Release 1.11.93 is the third release candidate for the OpenNMS 1.12 series. It contains more bugfixes, and makes Provisiond the default for answering node newSuspect events, rather than Capsd. To revert to the old behavior, set org.opennms.provisiond.enableDiscovery=false in opennms.properties.
The codename for 1.11.93 is Alan Doyle

section.title: Release 1.11.92
section.para: Release 1.11.92 is the third release candidate for the OpenNMS 1.12 series. It is identical to 1.11.91 except for a fix for reading eventconf.xml files that don't have an XML namespace attribute.
The codename for 1.11.92 is Steve Vai

section.title: Release 1.11.91
section.para: Release 1.11.91 is the second release candidate for the OpenNMS 1.12 series.
The codename for 1.11.91 is Joe Satriani

section.title: Release 1.11.90
section.para: Release 1.11.90 is the first release candidate for the OpenNMS 1.12 series.
The codename for 1.11.90 is John Roderick

section.title: Release 1.11.3
section.para: Release 1.11.3 is the latest in the unstable series of OpenNMS. It contains what will eventually be a part of the OpenNMS 1.12.x stable releases.
The codename for 1.11.3 is Jonathan Coulton

section.title: Release 1.11.2
section.para: Release 1.11.2 is the latest in the unstable series of OpenNMS. It contains what will eventually be a part of the OpenNMS 1.12.x stable releases.
The codename for 1.11.2 is Damian Hess

section.title: Release 1.11.1
section.para: Release 1.11.1 is the latest in the unstable series of OpenNMS. It contains what will eventually be a part of the OpenNMS 1.12.x stable releases.
The codename for 1.11.1 is Mike Doughty

section.title: Release 1.11.0
section.para: Release 1.11.0 is the first in the latest unstable series of OpenNMS. It contains what will eventually be a part of the OpenNMS 1.12.x stable releases.
The codename for 1.11.0 is MCA

section.title: Release 1.10.14
section.para: Release 1.10.14 is the latest in the stable 1.10 series of OpenNMS releases. It contains a few small bugfixes including an important security fix.
The codename for 1.10.14 is Chalumeau.

section.title: Release 1.10.13
section.para: Release 1.10.13 is the latest in the stable 1.10 series of OpenNMS releases. It contains a few small bugfixes.
The codename for 1.10.13 is Sopila.

section.title: Release 1.10.12
section.para: Release 1.10.12 is the latest in the stable series of OpenNMS releases. It contains a few bugfixes and enhancements, including a fix for the alarm detail page.
The codename for 1.10.12 is Arghul.

section.title: Release 1.10.11
section.para: Release 1.10.11 is the latest in the stable series of OpenNMS releases. It contains a few bugfixes and enhancements.
The codename for 1.10.11 is Nadaswaram.

section.title: Release 1.10.10
section.para: Release 1.10.10 is the latest in the stable series of OpenNMS releases. It contains a number of bugfixes and enhancements.
The codename for 1.10.10 is Tumpong.

section.title: Release 1.10.9
section.para: Release 1.10.9 is the latest in the stable series of OpenNMS releases. It contains a number of bugfixes and enhancements.
The codename for 1.10.9 is Nose Flute.

section.title: Release 1.10.8
section.para: Release 1.10.8 is the latest in the stable series of OpenNMS releases. It contains a number of bugfixes and enhancements.
The codename for 1.10.8 is Trikiti.

section.title: Release 1.10.7
section.para: Release 1.10.7 is the latest in the stable series of OpenNMS releases. It contains a number of bugfixes and enhancements.
The codename for 1.10.7 is Buccina

section.title: Release 1.10.6
section.para: Release 1.10.6 is the latest in the stable series of OpenNMS releases. It contains a number of bugfixes and enhancements.
The codename for 1.10.6 is Cornamuse.

section.title: Release 1.10.5
section.para: Release 1.10.5 is the latest in the stable series of OpenNMS releases. It contains a few minor bugfixes and enhancements.
The codename for 1.10.5 is Tromboon.

section.title: Release 1.10.4
section.para: Release 1.10.4 is the latest in the stable series of OpenNMS releases. It contains a few minor bugfixes and enhancements.
The codename for 1.10.4 is Archlute.

section.title: Release 1.10.3
section.para: Release 1.10.3 is the latest in the stable series of OpenNMS releases. It contains a few bugfixes, most notably an important deadlock fix when using provisiond.
The codename for 1.10.3 is Fiscorn.

section.title: Release 1.10.2
section.para: Release 1.10.2 is the latest in the stable series of OpenNMS releases. It contains bugfixes, including a fix for a filehandle leak regression, Windows installer fixes, and some minor enhancements.
The codename for 1.10.2 is Charango.

section.title: Release 1.10.1
section.para: Release 1.10.1 is the second in the latest series of stable releases. It contains plenty of bugfixes, as well as a few minor enhancements.
The codename for 1.10.1 is Hurdy Gurdy.

section.title: Release 1.10.0
section.para: Release 1.10.0 is the first in the latest series of stable releases.
The codename for 1.10.0 is Alboka.

section.title: Release 1.9.93
section.para: Release 1.9.93 is the latest in a series of development releases of OpenNMS. This represents what will eventually become OpenNMS 1.10.0 when it is blessed as the next stable release.
The codename for 1.9.93 is Kora.

section.title: Release 1.9.92
section.para: Release 1.9.92 is the latest in a series of development releases of OpenNMS. This represents what will eventually become OpenNMS 1.10.0 when it is blessed as the next stable release.
The codename for 1.9.92 is Superbone.

The codename for 1.9.91 is Crumhorn.

The codename for 1.9.90 is Balafon.

section.para: Release 1.9.8 is the latest in a series of development releases of OpenNMS. This represents what will eventually become OpenNMS 1.10.0 when it is declared feature-complete and stable.
The codename for 1.9.8 is Pulalu.

The codename for 1.9.7 is Naqara.

section.para: Release 1.9.6 is the latest in a series of development releases of OpenNMS. This represents what will eventually become OpenNMS 1.10.0 when it is declared feature-complete and stable.

The codename for 1.9.5 is Canjo.

The codename for 1.9.4 is Guzheng.

The codename for 1.9.3 is Recorder.

section.para: Release 1.9.2 is the latest in a series of development releases of OpenNMS. This represents what will eventually become OpenNMS 1.10.0 when it is declared feature-complete and stable.
The codename for 1.9.2 is Psaltery.

section.title: Release 1.9.1
section.para: Release 1.9.1 is the latest in a series of development releases of OpenNMS. This represents what will eventually become OpenNMS 1.10.0 when it is declared feature-complete and stable.
Since 1.9.0, a few new features were added.
The codename for 1.9.1 is Oboe.

section.title: Release 1.9.0
section.para: Release 1.9.0 is the latest in a series of development releases of OpenNMS. This represents what will eventually become OpenNMS 1.10.0 when it is declared feature-complete and stable.
Since 1.8, a few new features were added.
The codename for 1.9.0 is Timple.
